definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cover or seal with a cap.
( transitive ) To award a cap as a mark of distinction .
( transitive ) To lie over or on top of something.
( transitive ) To set (or reach) an upper limit on something.
( transitive , figurative ) To conclude ; to make something even more wonderful at the end.
( transitive , cricket ) To select a player to play for a specified side.
( transitive , slang ) To shoot (someone) with a firearm .
examples: If he don’t get outta my hood, I’m gonna cap his ass.
In a school shooting, where some kid caps a bunch of other kids, where did he get the weapon? From a family member, probably their gun cabinet.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , slang , originally African-American Vernacular ) To lie ; to tell a lie.
( transitive , sports ) To select to play for the national team.
examples: Peter Shilton is the most capped English footballer.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To salute by uncovering the head respectfully.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cover or seal with a cap.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To award a cap as a mark of distinction .
( transitive ) To lie over or on top of something.
( transitive ) To set (or reach) an upper limit on something.
( transitive , figurative ) To conclude ; to make something even more wonderful at the end.
( transitive , cricket ) To select a player to play for a specified side.
( transitive , slang ) To shoot (someone) with a firearm .

definitions.definition: To take a screenshot or to record a copy of a video.
To capture an objective , such as a flag or checkpoint .
To capitulate (cause to capitulate) an opponent .

main_definition: ( transitive , informal ) To convert text to uppercase .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To take a screenshot or to record a copy of a video.
( transitive , video games ) To capture an objective , such as a flag or checkpoint .
( transitive , intransitive , video games ) To capitulate (cause to capitulate) an opponent .
